title: Emotion Mapping
introText: Think back to a recent situation where you felt overwhelmed. By mapping your emotions and reflecting on how Half-Smile could have helped, you'll be better prepared to use this skill in the future.

sections.title: The Situation
sections.description: Describe a recent situation where you felt overwhelmed or emotionally reactive.
sections.placeholder: What happened? Where were you? Who was involved?

sections.title: Emotions Experienced
sections.description: What emotions did you experience? Try to name them specifically.
sections.placeholder: e.g., Frustration, anxiety, anger, sadness, overwhelm...

sections.title: Body Response
sections.description: How did your body react? Notice tension, breathing changes, or physical sensations.
sections.placeholder: e.g., Tight shoulders, clenched jaw, rapid heartbeat, shallow breathing...

sections.title: How Half-Smile Could Help
sections.description: Reflect on whether using Half-Smile could have helped in this situation. How might it have changed your experience?
sections.placeholder: e.g., It could have relaxed my face and signaled my body to calm down, creating space before reacting...

sections.title: Future Plan
sections.description: How will you incorporate Half-Smile into similar future situations?
sections.placeholder: e.g., When I notice my jaw clenching, I'll pause and adopt a half-smile before responding....
